lead_paragraph: An Irish tenor had sung the story of the immigrant Annie Moore many times, but it became more than an old tune when he learned he had a special connection to her.

headline.print_headline: Ballad of Ellis Island Adds a New Verse
headline.main: A New Verse in the Ballad of Ellis Island’s First Immigrant

snippet: An Irish tenor had sung the story of the immigrant Annie Moore many times, but it became more than an old tune when he learned he had a special connection to her.
abstract: Irish and American descendants of Annie Moore, first immigrant processed when Ellis Island opened in 1892, meet in Manhattan to attend Irish American Hall of Fame awards ceremony; genealogist Megan Smolenyak Smolenyak, who arranged reunion, discovered Moore lived her entire life in Manhattan and was buried in unmarked grave in Queens in 1924.
